profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:34:37 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REELS 1443-1445 & 3368-3369: A 26 volume journal, 1959-1985, including lists of art work, illustrated ideas for sculpture, scenarios for films, plans for sailboats, a studio and houses, teaching notes, and brief essays; a souvenir book published by Fridge in 1972 containing a chronology of his life and work with photographs and drawings of his sculpture, boats, houses and films; and printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 1915: Clippings, invitations, exhibition catalogs and announcements; sketches for a set design; an essay "Film in Art... A Philosophy," written for the University of Oklahoma; film awards; correspondence relating to films; and photographs.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 1443-1445 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 1915 available for through interlibrary loan.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 3368-3369 available for use only at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston; and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to the lender, Roy Fridge, after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sculptor and filmmaker; Port Aransas, Tex.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming by Fridge as part of the Archives of American Art's Texas project.
